column1: Stanbic Bank Uganda Limited (SBU) is a commercial bank in Uganda and is licensed by the Bank of Uganda
SBU is the largest commercial bank in the country
column3: the bank's total assets were valued at USh6.65 trillion (US$1.765 billion). At that time shareholders' equity was valued at USh1.078 trillion (US$286.3 million). As of June 2020
column4: the bank's total assets had increased to USh7.7 trillion (US$2.105 billion).In June 2018
column5: Fitch Rating Agency gave Stanbic Bank Uganda a AAA rating with a Stable outlook.

column1: SBU is listed on the Uganda Securities Exchange (USE)
column2: where it trades under the symbol SBU. It offers a range of banking products including Internet banking
column6: among other products. SBU is a subsidiary of Stanbic Africa Holdings Limited
column7: which is in turn owned by Standard Bank Group Limited.

column1: The bank was founded in Uganda as the National Bank of India in 1906. After several name changes
column3: Standard Bank bought the Grindlays Bank network in Africa. The new owners renamed the bank Stanbic Bank (Uganda) Limited.Stanbic Bank (Uganda) Limited is licensed as a merchant banker
column5: and financial adviser by the Capital Markets Authority
column6: which licensed the USE in 1997. In 2017 the bank was awarded a bancassurance licence from the Insurance Regulatory Authority
column7: authorizing Stanbic Bank to sell insurance products to its customers and the public.In February 2002
column8: Standard Bank acquired 90 percent shareholding in the Uganda Commercial Bank
column9: a government-owned retail banking operation with 65 branches. The new owners merged their new acquisition with their existing Stanbic Bank (Uganda) Limited to form Uganda's largest commercial bank by assets and branch network. In November 2005
column10: the government of Uganda divested its ownership in Stanbic Bank (Uganda) by listing its shares on the USE. Standard Bank also floated 10 percent of its shareholding at the same time
column11: reducing their ownership to 80 percent.On 19 February 2018
column12: SBU informed its shareholders of the Board of Directors’ decision to re-organize the company’s corporate structure and operations through the formation of a group with a holding company to be called ‘Stanbic Uganda Holdings Limited’ owning several subsidiaries engaged in different lines of businesses including a new banking Subsidiary which effectively began on 28 November 2018.

column1: Japheth Katto is chairman of the board. Patrick Mweheire is the managing director.

column2: SBU had a branch network of nearly 70 branches and 10 customers service points in all four regions of the country. Its network was the largest of all commercial banks in Uganda. At that time
column3: it maintained 173 networked automated teller machines. Listed below were some of the branches of the bank:
